snippet: Even though the number of registered Republicans in New York State has dropped by 228,000 since 2008, the party has reason for optimism as it looks toward the November elections.
abstract: Republican Party in New York State has reason for optimism as it looks toward the November elections, despite a significant drop in the number of registered Republicans in the state and the fact that no Republican has been elected to statewide office in a decade; a pragmatic alliance with Gov Andrew M Cuomo and the likelihood of retaining control of the Senate may bolster the party's strength.
lead_paragraph: Even though the number of registered Republicans in New York State has dropped by 228,000 since 2008, the party has reason for optimism as it looks toward the November elections.

headline.seo: Republicans, Outnumbered, Keep Power in New York State
headline.main: Republicans, Outnumbered, Keep Power in Albany
headline.print_headline: Republicans, Outnumbered, Keep Power In Albany
